intro: Mesembryanthemum lewisiae, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or ozark star, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its ability to store water in its leaves, making it drought-tolerant. The flowers are often pink or yellow and bloom during the warmer months.
